alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 5:19PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cherokee County through 615 PM CDT... At 519 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blanche, or near Little River Canyon National Preserve, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Tennala, Cherokee Rock Village, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Eastern Weiss Lake, Slackland, Western Weiss Lake, Moshat, Coloma, Weiss Dam, Yellow Creek Falls and Fullerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
